reviews.text_content: Excellent optical mouse.. Got this mouse recently. Very satisfied. Smooth, easy operation so far. Nice features like on/off switch and power sleep feature. Recommended.

Basic model. I have used many different wireless mice over the years. When I purchased these I thought that they would be like all the rest but they aren't. The wheel is only active in two axis. Of course one can roll it and then smart scroll can be selected by pushing down to activate the switch beneath it. The two switches that I find pretty important that are not there, however, are the left and right wheel switches. Very useful when the bottom scroll bar shows up on your screen indicating you have content off to the right or left. I'm still pushing this wheel to the right or left, wishing it would scroll...

Best wireless mouse I have owned.. My very first wireless mouse was a M185. Lasted me four years and likely would have lasted longer had it not gotten damaged during a recent move. I went through several models after that. Some lasted a few weeks, some, not even a few hours. So I want back to my roots and bought another M185. It's already outlasted all my other cheap units...combined. This really is the best mouse I have ever used and by far, the best bang for your buck.

Logitech M185 wireless mouse. Love it . Would love it even more if it were a little larger (would be easier to hold on to) and if the tiny on/off switch was located either on the front or rear of the mouse that would allow the tab on the switch to be larger and more user friendly. Since it is located on the underside of the mouse the on/off switch tab is so tiny you can barely snag it with your fingernail to turn it on/off!
Great wireless Mouse. Mouse works great. I use it with a Dell All-In-One PC.I especially like the manual shut off feature.

Easy to use & works great...... Basic mouse - no multiple add-ons here. Scroll, left & right click, which is just what I need for e-mail and surfing the web on my Dell laptop. No cursor 'drifting' whatsoever, plus Logitech's built in 'battery saver' program does seem to help cut down on their replacement. Recommend.

Logitech M185 Wireless Mouse. It's well designed, very comfortable and works very well. I've ordered several over the years and I do like this model more then others that I've tried, and I highly recommend it. By the way, I bought a specific color years ago that I liked a lot, and found it's very easy to pop off the colored top and snap in the FAVORITE color in its place. Of course you will have to take care in doing this, (the parts are plastic), but I've done it several times without any issues. Hope that tip helps.

offers.title: Logitech M185 Wireless 2-Button Optical Mouse w/Scroll-Wheel Nano 910-003204 NEW

reviews.text_content: You get what you pay for....... I couldn't believe that you can buy a Logitech Unifying Laser Mouse for 5 bucks. Even without the receiver and the fact that it is refurbished. That being said, I must say, it is sloppier than a Wine-O living in the Napa Valley and it feels really cheap in your hand, but hey, it was only 5 bucks, delivered!!!! Great for a back-up or take it on the road. Just don't drop it. You'll be picking up pieces for weeks. By the way, the exciting news is that it worked... right out of the mailing envelope. So if have a unifying keyboard and the receiver, you can't go wrong. Heck, buy a half a dozen for under $30 and toss 'em when the battery dies. That way you'll have a new one every time you change the battery.

Not a mouse trap..... This is a great mouse, small, fast responding and convenient. Price without the dongle was cheap so I ordered 4 of them. There is always some one who asks me if I have a spare mouse, daughter, grandkid. So, yes, here is a cheapo. I like the red color, easy to find. I did have to go to logitech's web site to down load a program to link up the new mouse with the dongle from my old logitech mouse. It was a simple thing to do. I really like the Logitech brand, they make great tv/stereo/vhs/ cd disc controllers.

Logitech Wireless Mouse is Great for Laptops. Works very nicely and is comfortable in the hand. The only thing is why can Logitech not make use of the internal bluetooth receiver in the laptop. Kind of a pain to have the dongle hanging out and using up a USB port, even if it is a tiny dongle.

Logitech does it again.. Logitech makes the best mouses. The legendary mx510 was my all time favorite but this is a close second. Logitech G Pro feels so comfortable in hand and moving around my mousepad smoother than butter. Great for gaming and any computer use in general to be honest.

Does the "mouse thing" very nicely!. This was my third purchase of this model -- and not because two went bad. Quite the contrary. I now have one for my desktop, one for my laptop, and one I passed on to a friend who needed a mouse for her new laptop. What can I say? It's lightweight and maneuverable in a way that my older "brick-size" mice were not. The unobtrusive USB receiver is super compact. And I like the fact that there is an on-off switch which should help with battery life. It's also handy, when I put the desktop to sleep, to turn the mouse off so if it's inadvertently bumped, it won't wake up the computer which used to happen a lot with my older, always-on, "brick". I've paid three different prices for the three units I've bought here on eBay -- $6, $14 & $8 -- all with shipping included, and at any of those pricesthey were a "deal". Great product!

Marvelous.. I have M185 for my desktop and I don't remember when I replaced the battery. It turns itself off when there is no movement, resulting in very long battery life. For laptop, I use another wireless mouse from company "MS" which needs manual ON and Off and still requires a fresh battery every couple of months. So I decided to replace this "MS" mouse with a new M185. And I found a good price from eBay, the mouse came in quickly, and it works well now.

The last mouse you will ever need...period!. As far as standard, 3-button, wheel scrolling mice go, the M185 is by far the best mouse to come out of Logitech. I have 3, one for each of my machines. I am an active MMO gamer, so I use my mouse constantly, even so the single AA battery will last me well over a year! It fits comfortably in the hand, and glides very smoothly. Talk about durable, my wife, used to drop hers all the time (on firm carpet) and it still works like new! Accurate, precise, there are not enough adjectives to describe how awesome this mouse is! I highly recommend the M185 wireless mouse to anyone needing a good reliable mouse.

Very good basic wireless mouse at a great price. It's a plain-old 2-button + scroll-wheel/button wireless mouse. It's small to medium size, very light, with good feel. What's nice about it is the typical price which is significantly lower than the competitive product (model 3500) from MS.I'm using it with a HP Pavilion laptop running Linux. No problems at all.

reviews.text_content: My Fave Mouse. Very light and easy to use - I much prefer it to all previous mice I've owned - though anyone with mammoth hands would probably find it to small. Having an on-off switch, the battery lasts for months. I so rarely have to change them that I lose track of how long they've lasted - and I daily use them for hours, having one for my LT and another for my PC.

EBay supplied Logitech M185. This looks and feels exactly the same as my other M185 that I have had for a few years, but is a poor equivalent.The original shows red or green when using the on and off switch, plus the "On - Off" marker is part of the mould instead of being in whiteThis makes it easy to quickly know the state of the deviceIts as though I have been sold a "Chinese copy"However, I cannot fault its functionalityTrev

HANDY MOUSE. This little mouse works well and I can use it without constantly thinking about the item - so that's a success.I had some trouble initially because the dongle had been put in an inaccessible space and i didn't find it. Either it is a returned mouse or the makers need to check their quality control. That apart I am pleased I bought it even though there are many cheaper and more trendy items in the market. I hope it works without problems for a long time. Only then can I see that the extra money was well spent - time will tell - but there is no long term system of reporting on any purchases.

Mice. Not as good as the M325, it is very jerky using the scroll wheel & on some mapping apps the magnification jump is too great I've tried to re adjust the number of lines the wheel represents to 1line but still its too great it goes from close up to way out with just one slight movement of the scroll wheel item has now been replace with the M325 that has no problem with mapping apps I suspect its the driver that is not good enough for this mouse!

A good no frills mouse. Whilst it felt lightweight when first received, it proved to work very well out of the packet and I soon got used to its weight (compared to the one it replaced). It sits well in the hand and has an on/off switch underneath. Searching the internet for the best price, this supplier seemed to be the cheapest. Win win.

LOGITECH M185 WIRELESS MOUSE REVIEW. My original logitech mouse started to play up after 6 years of constance use, I went looking for a replacement one and saw the logitech M185 Wireless mouse on ebay at a excellent low price on what i payed for the original one at a local computer supermarket,The M185 is dead easy to install pushing the usb plug in the back of the computer and pressing the next key to the shift key on the key board to recognise it,The new unit works a treat with no problems, cgs56f colin.

Bought for my wife and she loves it!. Light, colourful, comfortable in hand, seems well made, dead easy to install/use, does what a mouse should, off switch should save batteries (although it claims a year life from batteries anyway!)- just the job!

reviews.text_content: Excellent Product. I have used one of these with my desktop for a few years. My only issue is that when the battery is low it seems to start double clicking. Not a big problem - just change the battery!I bought a second for use with my laptop. I had a slight panic as I thought the USB dongle wasn't there, then realised it was stored inside the battery compartment. Actually a good design feature.I was also concerned that it may use the dongle of my old mouse but it seems to have its' own frequency so there is no interference. Again, a good design feature.I feel it is a good, cheap dependable mouse.

Second one I've bought. I don't want anything fancy from a mouse, but I do want it to work smoothly and without trailing cables. This does the job very well. I have two reservations:1) It isn't Bluetooth, the mouse's little USB dongle using the only USB-A port on my laptop.2) This is the second one I've bought, the middle button stopped working on the first. The first one lasted about a year.

Excellent and frugal. Easy to handle, convenient dongle doesn't stick out of the usb port. The buttons are very easy to click - minimal effort, makes for comfortable work over long term. Red is a nice touch, plastics are nicely textured, build quality is very good. I have been using an older model for years (it's still going strong), this is for the new computer. Takes a single battery and goes for ages. If the battery stops working - just rotate it a few times and you will get another day of work out of it.

Best mouse for the price. I bought this for my daughter as I already have 2 of these (one for work and one for home) and they have been very comfortable to use and ultra-reliable. I bought the red one for her to make sure we didn't get them mixed up!

Perfect all round. Slim design. Efficient. Good Colours to choose from. But most importantly, it connects easily to my Laptop (No CD required), and it ONLY uses one battery (not 2). My wife liked the one which I bought, and wanted one for herself. I have the Blue, and my wife got the Red. As a long time computer user, I very much Recommend it.
Mousy with no tail. Fits in the palm of the hand nicely and very reliable.All very simple to use with a decent brand name.Hard to fault.
Great Product. Came within a timely manner as my other one had packed up a d WFH without a mouse can prove difficult, thanks for the quick turnaround.

Great quality and good value. Nice and very simple design, great for everyday use. Good wireless connection that always works. Couldn't ask any more for what I've been looking for. Long lasting. Overall very happy with this mouse.

Superb value and smooth operation!. Great little product at the right price point!Installation on a Windows 7 PC was almost instantaneous with the neatly contained USB dongle which is cleverly located in the battery (supplied!) compartment.A little smaller than my wired Logitech mouse, which is nice... and it works smoothly and accurately on a variety of surfaces. Buttons are positive and not overly noisy and the scroll wheel and button work smoothly.Overall, a great little mouse that has worked flawlessly in the time I've had it and I would recommend it to anyone!

Good basic mouse.. Perfectly good for its price. Small and easy to plug in. great functions. Squeaky sound when pressing buttons only negative aspect, can be slightly annoying. Feels like you want to oil up the thing.

reviews.text_content: Great features, great price. Nice sleek design, no problems connecting to the computer, easy to carry around. My only complaint is that it is a little small; but, I've learned how to orient my hand differently to make it more comfortable.

Disappointed. Mouse received without a battery. Mouse itself is not responsive, and floats over the screen anywhere. It also freezes, and will not move. I have always had a M185 mouse, and this is different from the others. Totally disappointed, and will be repurchasing same model from a different supplier. I would certainly not recommend.

Dull but reliable.. Having bought a few cheap and nasty mice/mouses over the last couple of years and finding that they lasted no time at all before turning to mush, I decided to buy a Logitech because we've had the brand before. Good decision, feels right in the hand. Although at present its sometimes necessary to click twice when once should be enough, this may be due to settings on the computer that need to be changed rather than being a fault with the mouse. Overall pretty happy.

So good I bought.....(another!). We have all heard of the expression 'buy cheap, buy twice', well I did it three times before realising that it takes a well known brand-name to get a decent mouse.This mouse is by no means, a high-end, gaming mouse, but it is simple, ergonomic, comfortable and does the job well on numerous surface types. It has an on/off button, but I must confess I never use it as the battery seems to go on and on for months.Although it only has three buttons, Logitech software can been downloaded to enable you to make the scroll wheel into a 'back' button if you wish or in fact assign any other combinations such as make it left-handed. The software also warns you when the mouse battery is low.Having bought three unbranded mice from China over a period of a year, that fell apart, didn't work on wooden tables, or broke within 2 months, I thought it was time to spend a little more and purchase one with a name I knew. Actually, I liked it so much....I bought another for a friend.

Pleasantly surprised.. This is easy to set up, didn't come with an instruction book, however 3 minutes on youtube to see how it works. This allows my cat to pinch my bar stool in front of my laptop, and I can sit 6 feet away on me spare stool. Turn full screen on and bobs ya uncle wide screen entertainment. A few quirks to find out about but overall no probs. Oh i did find the receiver inside the mouse in the battery compartment thanks to youtube.

So good, I brought three over time!. No waiting for bluetooth signals etc. Instantly on and works perfectly. Only potential problem is that it is possible that sometimes the battery can slip loose and cause the mouse to stop working. I find the rounded contour very natural. What I like best, using a browser, is that clicking on a URL with the scroll wheel in the centre opens the URL in another tab. Very useful and time saving.

EASY TO USE WITH VERY POSITIVE PRESS-BUTTONS & BATTERY LASTS AGES.. Excellent to use because it is not too small and has very positive press buttons. Also it only uses one AA battery which are widely available or can be re-charged. One alkaline battery seems to last for ages in this product, even if the unit is unintentially left switched on for a few days. It is so good and easy to use, that I immediately bought another one.

Fantastic product !!. Good value for money, works perfectly and got a very comfortable grip. There are cheaper versions, but I recommend this product. Logitech is a very trusted brand anyway, and once more they didn't let me down. Fantastic product, thanks

Logical Choice Logitech. This is one of an array of Logitech mice I have owned over the years. I had three but one was kidnapped by my partner. This model is another great optical wireless mouse that is comfortable to use. Not too small and the batteries will last for months. Jut plug in and you are set to go. Works well with Windows 10 too.

Just as it comes.. I have a couple of Logitech wireless mice already and am surprised as each one seems better than the last. The Logitech M185 is at the bottom end, in pricing terms, of the wireless Logitech computer mice. However it does not disappoint in any way. It feels good quality, solid, very responsive and could not be easier to get it working. The size is perfect for your laptop being slightly on the smaller side and without all the flashy alternative buttons everywhere. Almost perfect just as it comes highly recommended.
Light weight and accurate. The mouse is very good value and comfortable to handle. Also very precise and accurate.

Almost perfect...... I bought this as a replacement for a very similar model which filed after a few years of use. Whilst this one worked straight out of the box as expected, it has an annoying habit of going to sleep after periods of inactivity, even when left switched on. Other than that, it's spot on for my needs

Perfect mouse for all types of use. Perfect design with compartment for paired usb Wi-Fi, battery is saved automatically mouse goes to sleep if not used, it also has an on/off switch for use when travelling with the laptop.Brilliant!!

Disappointed. Mouse received without a battery. Mouse itself is not responsive, and floats over the screen anywhere. It also freezes, and will not move. I have always had a M185 mouse, and this is different from the others. Totally disappointed, and will be repurchasing same model from a different supplier. I would certainly not recommend.

Excellent. This mouse is perfect for your every day needs. It has an extremely easy setup, just plug in the receiver to your laptop and you're done. As a student who has to do work all the time, I can say that I am satisfied.

DO NOT BUY - CHEAP COPY, NOT LOGITECH. Do not buy this mouse. The one I received was NOT a Logitech product. The packaging and mouse have been made to look very like a Logitech product, however on inspection of the mouse, it is made of cheap quality plastic. Internal wires are visible and the USB dongle is made of 3d printed plastic.

reviews.text_content: Long battery life, easy to use. No hassles. Long battery life, easy to use. good price and well designed. Don't waste your time with other cheapo brands.

Fuzzy sound, crackly bass, overall not happy. they were fine for a few months and now have turned to total crap, can watch movies on them but not listen to music as there is just to much distortion, not impressed wouldnt buy this model again, i have another set of logitech pc speakers that are 5 years old and going strong, i wish i could say the same for these.

Headphone Jack does not always work. it has happened a few times where only one side of the speaker works while the other doesnt, its so frustrating that I have to pull out the connection from pc and replug in it a few times before both speakers work again. 2/5 otherwise sound quality is bearable.
Excellent for the price. Great value system that replaced 10+ years old similar Logitech system that had a speaker paper break after much use. Looking forward to the new system lasting as long.

Pound for pound. This is not the best that money can buy but for the pice point it's damn good quality if you want the walls to quake look elsewhere, but if you want really good clarity at a reasonable volume level then this is what you want. It comes with what you would expect from Logitech great design at a reasonable price point. I'm thoroughly happy with this for my pc.

That too, may be because I have an old PC.

Look for a different model.. I have owned a few Logitech devices and even a few mice, but this one is the worst I have ever used. It stutters and jumps no matter what I use to run the mouse on. My old Logitech mouse that this one was to replace was buttery smooth. This one is as smooth as crunchy peanut butter.My advice is look for a different model.

reviews.text_content: Very comfortable but a bit fussy. A good wireless mouse.I purchased this mouse to replace my old mouse which died.Unlike my old mouse which worked on any surface this one is a lot more fussy about the surface it will work on. For example it will not work on plain white paper, which my desk is covered with.It will also jump and stop when I use it directly on my shiney desk. It likes a mouse pad or the back of a pad. Which, when you are busy is a bit annoying, I will persevere for a while longer but may have to replace it to avoid the frustration.

Excellent product. I have two computers using these. One is 18mths old and the other would have to have been bought about 2013-14.To date I have had no trouble with either, however I always like to have a back up so naturally I bought the same again.It is easy to install, comfortable to use and well priced. I would recommend these to anyone.
